title: Bullish US equity sentiment at 10-month low
text:
"The cyclical weakness has been evident for sometime now and also been predicted by the yield curve for many months," Mr Lee said. "But we are not in the 'late cycle' camp and see the downturn as a logical consequence of trade tensions, last year's oil crash and Fed tightening."

Mr Lee said now that the Fed has begun easing, "we think it is just a matter of time before the cyclical outlook improves".

Ryan Detrick, a market strategist at LPL Financial, said there could be more volatility and potential weakness this month, though he was overall optimistic.

"“Yes, this has been a historically bad start to the fourth quarter. But the good news is when the S &P 500 has been up more than 15 per cent for the year heading into the usually bullish fourth quarter, the returns actually became stronger during the fourth quarter.

“In fact, since WWII this has happened 17 times," Mr Detrick said. "The fourth quarter was in the green 15 times with a median return of a very impressive 4.6 per cent.”

Neutral sentiment steady, bearish sentiment leaps

Neutral sentiment, expectations that stock prices will stay essentially unchanged over the next six months, rose 1.8 percentage points to 39.2 per cent. Neutral sentiment was last at this level on May 22, 2019.

As for bearish sentiment, expectations that stock prices will fall over the next six months, it leapt 6.2 percentage points to 39.4 per cent. Pessimism remains above its historical average of 30.5 per cent for the ninth time in 11 weeks.

Bullish sentiment is back at an unusually low level for the first time in five weeks. Historically, such readings have been followed by higher-than-average and higher-than-median six- and 12-month S &P 500 index returns.

Neutral and bearish sentiment are within but near the upper end of their respective typical ranges, the association said.

This week’s drop in bullish sentiment follows the return of downside volatility to the stock market and weaker-than-expected economic reports.

Many individual investors have been monitoring trade negotiations, particularly between the US and China, the association also said.

Also having an influence on sentiment are Washington politics, geopolitics, valuations, corporate earnings, monetary policy and interest rates.
description: The bull market is running low on bullish sentiment, according to the latest survey by the American Association of Individual Investors.
